keyword: calories in one shot of vodka
title: Calories in One Shot of Vodka
meta_description: Discover calories in one shot of vodka, including alcohol content, zero carbs or fat, and quick tweaks for variations like proof strength.
h1: Calories in One Shot of Vodka
assumptions: Standard 1.5 oz (44 ml) serving of 80-proof (40% ABV) plain vodka, distilled from grains.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, proof, serving size, and any mixers added. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One shot of 80-proof vodka contains ~96 kcal, all from alcohol, with no carbs, protein, or fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one shot of vodka?
faqs.a: About 96 kcal for a standard 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof vodka.

faqs.q: Does vodka have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: Plain vodka has 0 g carbs and 0 g sugars; calories come solely from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in vodka?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more caloriesâ€”e.g., 100-proof adds ~24 kcal per shot.

faqs.q: Is vodka low-carb for keto diets?
faqs.a: Yes, plain vodka is keto-friendly with 0 g net carbs per shot.

faqs.q: What about calories if mixed with soda?
faqs.a: Plain vodka is 96 kcal, but adding soda or juice increases totals based on the mixer.
